Vacuum Cleaner Market Size & Trends

The global vacuum cleaner market size was valued at USD 13.65 billion in 2023 and is expected to grow at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 10.0% from 2024 to 2030. The market growth is attributed to the rising demand for vacuum cleaners driven by increasing applications across residential, commercial, as well as industrial spaces. Moreover, factors such as changing lifestyles, high disposable incomes, and a growing working population are enhancing the outlook of the overall vacuum cleaner market further. The growth of the market is being largely influenced by the rapid technological developments facilitating ease of usage and lesser human intervention. A prominent example of such development is the advent of robotic vacuum cleaners that efficiently clean spaces without human intervention. For instance, in September 2023, several vacuum cleaner manufacturers showcased their offerings at the IFA 2023 tech trade show in Berlin. At this event, Ecovacs unveiled the upgraded version of its robot vacuum Deebot X2 Omnia, comprising a fully automated all-in-one cleaning station that can operate autonomously with greater efficiency.

The increased influence of social media and online sales platforms has emerged as one of the most important growth drivers of the market. Social media platforms have been instrumental in increasing awareness about the need to maintain hygiene along with rolling out information about technologically advanced products and new launches.

The vacuum cleaner industry is undergoing significant changes driven by changing customer dynamics and innovative technologies. Cleaning is becoming smart with the implementation of smart applications and robotic technologies to create new value from data emerging from different industry verticals. Apart from digitally enhanced products, companies are focusing on developing sustainable products with low emissions and noise.

Market Concentration & Characteristics

The market for vacuum cleaner is witnessing a high degree of innovation, particularly with the integration of IoT technologies such as Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, along with self-cleaning, anti-allergen filtration, and smartphone control.Increasing penetration of technologies has brought various innovations in vacuum cleaners and benefited manufacturers to enhance the vacuum cleaning abilities of their products & expand their customer base across the globe.

The vacuum cleaner market is witnessing a significant impact of government regulations and policies as governments across the globe are setting regulatory frameworks for vacuum cleaner manufacturers to lower their energy consumption and develop eco-friendly solutions. For instance, the vacuum cleaner energy label rule minimizes wattage from 1,600 watts to 900 watts for vacuum cleaner manufacture or sale in Europe.

The market is also being influenced by the rising number of mergers & acquisition activities that help companies increase market share, expand the customer base, and strengthen product portfolios.

End-user concentration is high in the market, as several industry verticals are adopting efficient cleaning solutions to keep the remises free of high volumes of hazardous dust and awkward debris. Moreover, they are also witnessing heightened adoption rates in commercial as well as residential spaces, thereby increasing the end-user concentration of the market.

Product Insights

The canister segment accounted for the largest revenue share of around 25.0% in 2023 owing to their high demand driven by their ability to clean various surfaces fit in tight spaces, and maneuver around obstacles. The segmental growth is being further propelled by the availability of canister vacuum cleaners equipped with a HEPA filter, which has a significantly low risk of causing pulmonary side effects such as allergies and asthma. For instance, PUPPYOO offers the T12 Plus Rinse vacuum cleaner featuring an advanced 6-stage HEPA filter designed to prevent air pollution.

The robotic segment is expected to record the highest CAGR from 2024 to 2030, with increasing consumer demand for more convenient cleaning solutions. Robotic vacuum cleaners simplify and speed up the cleaning process through automation. Unlike conventional vacuum cleaners, these vacuum cleaners can work independently and navigate through hard-to-reach areas and corners. The rising demand for these vacuum cleaners due to features such as automatic charging, smart home trend, and voice-activated commands powered by digital voice assistants is contributing to the segmental growth further.

Distribution Channel Insights

The online distribution channel segment is estimated to register a notable growth rate from 2024 to 2030. The growing consumer proclivity toward online purchases of electronic gadgets is positively influencing segmental growth. The wide availability of vacuum cleaners on the e-commerce platforms, as well as online sales channels of the manufacturers at attractive price points, is expediting the growth of the online segment further. For instance, in February 2022, Fantasia Trading LLC, which develops smart-home devices, added its eufy cordless handheld vacuum cleaner for sale on Amazon to provide an improved and seamless customer experience.

The offline distribution channel segment held a considerable revenue share in 2023 owing to the wide availability of vacuum cleaners across the retail stores. Several consumers prefer buying electronic gadgets directly through the stores as it allows them to check and try the products, which, in turn, quickens the purchasing decision. Besides, several electronic retail stores offer competitive prices and attractive discounts which makes the offline distribution channel still a preferred option among consumers, thereby driving the segmental growth.

Power Source Insights

The corded segment accounted for the highest market share in 2023 owing to their increasing demand driven by the high usability of these devices. Corded vacuum cleaners feature higher suction power as they are plugged into the main unit and offer a higher capacity to collect dust. Moreover, the canister in these vacuum cleaners doesn’t require frequent emptying. As a result, these vacuum cleaners offer effective performance and are most suitable for cleaning industrial premises, large commercial spaces, large homes with carpets, pets, kids, etc. In addition, they come with several tools and changeable parts that make cleaning an easy process, leading to their increased demand and segmental growth.

The cordless segment is anticipated to expand at the highest CAGR from 2024 to 2030. The growth is attributed to the growing popularity of cordless vacuum cleaners as they offer greater convenience and portability, and they are easy to move. Besides, some cordless vacuum cleaners can also be converted to handheld cleaners for cleaning quick spots, driving their demand to a greater extent and contributing to the segment growth.

Application Insights

The residential segment accounted for the largest market share in 2023 owing to the rising popularity of vacuum cleaners as household appliances that offer greater convenience amid busy schedules and changing lifestyle patterns among people. Moreover, increasing incidences of allergy and asthma caused due to the dust and dirt in residential settings, coupled with the need to keep homes disease-free, are driving the demand for residential vacuum cleaners. Furthermore, the rising availability of advanced products that can capture the tiniest of impurities efficiently is driving the market growth in residential applications.

The commercial segment is expected to register the highest CAGR from 2024 to 2030, owing to increasing demand for cleaning equipment across commercial settings in line with the growing awareness regarding hygiene and cleanliness. This is urging the manufacturers to develop innovative offerings that can meet consumer demands. For instance, in March 2022, Creative Newtech Limited launched a robotic vacuum cleaner, Dustor, built with LiDAR technology. Designed especially for healthcare facilities, this device maps the space and then cleans the surfaces and difficult corners. It can also be used at any time as per the schedule and accessed from anywhere at convenience.

Regional Insights

The vacuum cleaner market in North America is expected to record a significant growth rate of nearly 10.0% from 2024 to 2030. The growth is attributed to the increasing demand for technologically advanced products with enhanced features such as IoT connectivity, voice control, and remote control, as well as the rising consumer awareness regarding indoor air quality and cleanliness. In addition, the growth of the e-commerce sector and the availability of a wide range of vacuum cleaners through online channels is also favoring regional market growth.

U.S. Vacuum Cleaner Market Trends

The vacuum cleaner market in the U.S. is driven by increasing consumer awareness about indoor air quality, the need for efficient and effective cleaning products, and technological advancement. Moreover, the trend toward smart home automation is also expected to contribute to the market's growth in the coming years

Asia Pacific Vacuum Cleaner Market Trends

Vacuum cleaner market in Asia Pacific accounted for largest revenue share of over 32% in 2023, owing to rising demand for vacuum cleaners in the region driven by the strong presence of several major players, increasing consumer expenditure, and availability of low-cost products. These players are largely focusing on launching innovative and cost-effective solutions to strengthen their position in the region. For instance, in April 2022, Panasonic Holdings Corporation launched MC-YL633, a dry vacuum cleaner with an 18L dust tank capacity and high suction power of 2000W. The company launched this product in India at an affordable price point to suit the needs of customers in the country. Besides, the ongoing expansion of the e-commerce sector coupled with rising consumer preference for the online purchase of electronic products is also creating lucrative growth prospects for the regional market.

India vacuum cleaner market is estimated to record a notable growth rate of 12% from 2024 to 2030. The market is dominated by international brands such as Dyson, Philips, and Eureka Forbes. Changing lifestyle patterns and increasing disposable incomes is contributing to the growth of the market in the country.

The vacuum cleaner market in China accounted for the highest market share in 2023 owing to increasing product demand in the country, driven by growing inclination of households toward maintaining clean living environments.

Japan vacuum cleaner market is expected to witness a CAGR of 10% from 2024 to 2030. There is a growing demand for smart and connected devices, with some manufacturers offering vacuum cleaners that can be controlled through mobile apps or voice assistants.

Europe Vacuum Cleaner Market Trends

Vacuum cleaner market in Europe accounted for a market share of 24% in 2023 owing to increased demand from the residential, commercial, and industrial sectors. The market is driven by factors such as urbanization's need for energy-efficient and eco-friendly vacuum cleaners. The market is also influenced by technological advancements such as the development of cordless and robot vacuum cleaners.

UK vacuum cleaner market is being proliferated by the increasing consumer awareness about health and hygiene, rising disposable incomes, and wide availability of smart home appliance in the country.

Vacuum cleaner market in Germany is estimated to record a CAGR of around 10.0% from 2024 to 2030. German consumers also value high-quality and durable products, which has led to a rise in demand for premium vacuum cleaner brands.

Middle East and Africa (MEA) Vacuum Cleaner Market Trends

The vacuum cleaner market in the Middle East and Africa (MEA) region is anticipated to grow at a significant rate from 2024 to 2030. The market growth is being driven by the increasing demand for vacuum cleaners due to increasing disposable incomes and growing consumer expenditure on household appliances.

Saudi Arabia vacuum cleaner market is accounted for a considerable revenue share in 2023 owing to increasing expansion of various leading manufacturers in the country. Besides, increasing affordability and growing consumer inclination toward high-tech home appliances is contributing to the market growth further.

Key Vacuum Cleaner Company Insights

The key players operating in the vacuum cleaner market are investing aggressively in research and development to introduce innovative. They are also forming strategic alliances and engaging in merger & acquisition initiatives to gain a competitive edge in the market. For instance, in March 2022, Snow Joe LLC acquired Slick Products, a cleaning and detailing spray, pressure washer foam provider. This acquisition aimed to develop and distribute new products offering by leveraging best in-class technological eCommerce infrastructure.

Panasonic Corporation expanded its product portfolio through the launch of several high-end technology-based solutions. For instance, in March 2023, the company launched new cordless stick vacuum cleaner in Malaysian market the MC-SB33 and MC-SB53K. This follows the launch of its Tangle-Free Hair Cordless Stick Vacuum Cleaner.

Recent Developments

In January 2024, Dreame International, Ltd. Introduced its complete range of smart home products at the CES 2024 event. The company unveiled various new smart cleaning appliances, such as DreameBot X30 Ultra, DreameBot L10s Pro Ultra, DreameBot L20 Ultra, Dreame H13 Pro Wet and Dry Vacuum, Dreame Z10 Station Cordless Vacuum Cleaner.

January 2024, Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. announced to launch a new vacuum cleaner rangeBespoke Jet Bot Combo, equipped with advanced artificial intelligence features at CES 2024. This new range is a vacuum and mop robot cleaner that offers steam cleaning and improved AI features to help gain an easier cleaning experience for the customers.

In June 2023, Dyson launched the new generation of cord free vacuums with the Dyson Gen5outsize and Gen5detect. The latter is a powerful cordless vacuum that features a fifth-generation Hyperdymium motor, delivering 280 air watts of powerful suction. These machines provide a fully sealed HEPA filtration system designed to collect 99.9% of viruses and 99.99% of particles down to 0.1 microns.

In March 2023, Alfred Kärcher SE & Co. KG launched B 50W new range of scrubber dryers, which is suitable for applications such as showrooms, hospitals, and industrial warehouses.

In February 2023, BISSELL Inc. company launched BISSELL CrossWave HydroSteam, a multi-surface cleaner with in-built 3-in-1 technology of part vacuum, part mop, and part steam cleaner working in unison.
